summary:
Vietnamese is the main language of Vietnam, spoken by about 85 million people. It's part of the Austroasiatic language family and is known for its tones and analytic structure. The language uses words with one to eight syllables, not just one syllable as some people think.

Vietnamese is written with a unique alphabet called chữ Quốc ngữ, which is based on the Latin script. Before this, a different system called chữ Nôm, using Chinese-style characters, was used. The Vietnamese alphabet includes special letters and marks for tones.
title: Vietnamese language
